Entries.default: "You can see me? It's really you, then, the captain of the Defiance?"
"It's [Player Ship], but yes."
"Who's asking?"
"You've got the wrong captain."
"Why are you on my ship?"
"Me, Muātu! Formerly of the island Kazuwari, presently of the Beyond."
"But you are a Watcher, aren't you? I wouldn't be able to see you, otherwise. "Maybe you can still help!"
"But it must be you! You opened the box. You can see me!"
"Oh, this is fantastic! How satisfying it is to know one did not give one's life in vain."
"I come from the island of Kazuwari, and we need your aid!"
"Who are you?"
"So how'd you come to be dead?"
"Who is this 'we?'"
"What kind of aid do you need?"
"How did you know who I was?"
"An unfortunate side effect of encountering a swiftly moving blade at roughly shoulder height, yes."
"We had to get a messenger to you, but we couldn't let me be seen leaving Kazuwari. An inelegant solution, maybe, but an efficient one!"
"Why did you think I was this captain?"
"The people of Kazuwari are, ah, wary of the uninitiated. For good reason, of course!"
"Well, there's me, obviously."
"And then there's the caretaker, Humaire. She was the one who killed me and put my head in that box."
"And I suppose the people and souls of the island, as well."
"That will be difficult to explain before you've visited the island."
"Suffice it to say someone brought us something from your battle with the Drake off the coast of Maje Island."
"We learned a tremendous amount about you - and your abilities - from it!"
"Kazuwari is an island where the most skillful hunters, the most hardened explorers, the deadliest warriors, all gather to earn Toamowhai's favor."

"But Humaire, the island's caretaker, says the essence that sustains the island has sickened. 'Curdled,' she called it.

"The animals, the trees, they all churn with anger and fear."
"Have blights formed?"
"Why in the gods' names would I want to help you?"
"Who is Toamowhai?"
"I'm the greatest warrior. Why haven't I heard about this place?"
"You mentioned Toamowhai's favor. I could use a little divine favor."
"I have much greater concerns than your island."
"Yes! Humaire was right. She said you would understand!"
"The Faces of the Hunt! That which hunts, kills, and endures. Respectively."
"Some believe them to be the tripartite aspects of Galawain. Not that I would know - I've never asked them."
"I can't explain the whims of Toamowhai. Perhaps you might have with time, but only Toamowhai's best beloved are welcome there."
"Only they can truly appreciate what it offers."
"The favor comes in many forms, all of them wondrous! Toamowhai is very generous to the strongest among us."
"Ah, you refer to the dawn god - Humaire said you might. She believes that what's happening on Kazuwari is related!"
"Or at the very least, that what you gain from visiting the island will help you in your larger goals."
"They say you help people. That you fix problems. Kazuwari has problems. It needs your help!"
"Aiding us will require you pit yourself against some of the toughest foes Eora has to offer!"
"There are fine spoils to be found on the island for those who prove themselves worthy of Toamowhai's regard!"
"Speak to Humaire at Kazuwari, Watcher. She'll be able to better explain the situation than I am."
"There's one thing you should know - the Faces of the Hunt jealously control who enters and leaves the island."
"But there's a waterfall on the southern side of the island that will allow you to sneak in, so long as you're circumspect."
"I guess you should also know..." He grimaces.
"I'll help however I can."
"No promises."
"Helping people who don't want my help? Sounds like fun."
"I'm not interested in fixing your problems."
"Oh, that's fantastic! Thank you!"
"I understand. You have a god to chase!"
"They're really not so bad once you get to know them. They're almost... nice?"
"Well, no, that's a lie. But Humaire's all right."

"Once we've arrived, I can help you find your way in to the heart of the island.

"You know, if you want me to. I wouldn't want to presume."
"I gave my life for Kazuwari! I hope you can at least give some of your time."
"If you change your mind, I can show you the safest ways into the heart of the island."
"In the meantime, I'll be here. Well, behind you, really, with the rest of the spirits following you around."

"Oh, but that's a terrible shame. We hear much of his great deeds..."

The spirit's tone grows wistful, almost reverent.
Entries.female:
"Oh, but that's a terrible shame. We hear much of her great deeds..."

The spirit's tone grows wistful, almost reverent.

Entries.default: "He met the treacherous nāga in bloody combat at Hasongo and triumphed!"
Entries.female: "She met the treacherous nāga in bloody combat at Hasongo and triumphed!"

Entries.default: "He did fiery battle with the goddess of war herself at Ashen Maw and did not falter!"
Entries.female: "She did fiery battle with the goddess of war herself at Ashen Maw and did not falter!"

Entries.default: "I should be so lucky to meet such a peerless warrior as he!"
Entries.female: "I should be so lucky to meet such a peerless warrior as she!"

Entries.default: "Why couldn't anyone know you left?"
"You're more excitable than most of the spirits I meet."
"Funny thing about being dead - you know those social limiters? The little spoken and unspoken rules that keep us all in check? Stripped away! I'm more myself now than I ever was in life."
"Some of us take more to death than others, I suspect." The spirit's indistinct face splits into a frightfully wide grin.
"You're in the In-Between, I'm in the Here. The Beyond is, well, beyond the In-Between."
"Oh. Well. This is the first time I've ever been dead."
"Did you say something?" Aloth looks up from his book, a brow raised.
[Wave him off.]
"I'm talking to a spirit. I'll explain later."
[Ignore him.]
"What a surprise." He rolls his eyes and returns to reading.
"You okay over there? You got that look again, like you've seen a ghost. Another ghost, I mean."
"Tell him I said hi. Or her, I guess. Shouldn't go assuming things about the dead."
Aloth rolls his eyes and returns to reading.
"Shows me for caring." He gnaws on the end of his pipe.
"More than that, I won't say. Spirits shouldn't be in the business of making promises, not when we can't reasonably keep them!"
"Me, Muātu! Formerly of the island Kazuwari, presently of the Beyond."
"You're in the In-Between, I'm in the Here. The Beyond is, well, beyond the In-Between."
"Oh. Well. This is the first time I've ever been dead."
"Did you say something?" Aloth looks up from his book, a brow raised.
"You okay over there? You got that look again, like you've seen a ghost. Another ghost, I mean."
"I'm talking to a spirit. I'll explain later."
[Wave him off.]
[Ignore him.]
"What a surprise." He rolls his eyes and returns to reading.
"Tell him I said hi. Or her, I guess. Shouldn't go assuming things about the dead."
Aloth rolls his eyes and returns to reading.
"Shows me for caring." He gnaws on the end of his pipe.
"You speak of the Changeling, the Father of Monsters, the hunter Galawain."
"That which hunts, kills, and endures, yes! You understand!"
"Why ask me? What can I do about it that its caretaker can't?"
"You're a Watcher, right? The Watcher? The one who died and lived again? Who speaks to the gods? "That's the Watcher we need."
"We need a Watcher. No one else can talk to souls, Humaire said, and souls are our problem."
"But I'm sure that won't be a problem for you!"
Before you have a chance to respond to the spirit's warning, you notice Konstanten hovering nervously behind you.
"Did you need something?"
"Not now, Konstanten."
[Ignore him.]
"No, you know, I just-" He clears his throat nervously.
"Sure, sure." His gaze flicks from the box, then to your face, and back again.

He clears his throat, trying to get your attention. When you don't respond, he sighs deeply and comes to stand beside you.

He stares at the box, a frown etched deep in his face.
"Thing is, I might know something about that box there. A little more than something."

"All I'm saying is... maybe you don't want to touch it. Maybe we tie a big rock to it and throw it overboard.

"Right now."
"I'm going to need a bit more to go on than that."
"Spit it out."
[Shrug.] "Seems harmless to me."
"It's a box with a dead man's head in it."
"I've seen weirder."
"Actually, there's a spirit in the head, too."
"Fair point."
[Say nothing.]

"All I'm saying is... maybe you don't want to touch it. Maybe we tie a big rock to it and throw it overboard.

"Right now."
"...Great. That's- that's great."
"You say that, but you've never been to Kazuwari. Shit's weird. Weirder than usual, even for you."
"I'm not about to tell you how to do your job, but... Watcher? Be careful."
"Hey, hello, I'm still here!"
"Are you going to help us? We could really use the help."
"You seem to know a lot about this. Why is that?"
[Nod.]
[Roll your eyes.]
From the edge of your hearing, you catch the echoed words of one of your companions, as if from down a long hall.
"You caught me."
"More like get spoken at by gods."
"Don't believe everything you hear."
"I knew it! I knew Humaire wouldn't have lied!"
"Oh, I don't! Not unless Humaire says it. She always tells the truth, and she said the Watcher speaks to the gods, so it must be true."
"You will help, won't you?"
"I'll help if I can. What do you need me to do?"
"The island's residents might not take too kindly to your presence if you're found. They're a, ah, prickly bunch."
"He met the treacherous nāga in parley at Hasongo and made them flee in terror!"
Entries.female: "She met the treacherous nāga in parley at Hasongo and triumphed!"

Entries.default: Muātu cocks his head and smiles.
"Besides you being the only non-adra thing glowing like a campfire for miles?"
"I do talk to the living, too, you know."
"Of course, of course, but anyone can do that! "Well, nearly anyone. Not me. Because of... you know."
"Someone brought us something from the battle between the Defiance and the Drake off of Maje Island."
"We learned a lot about the Watcher of Caed Nua from it."
"Why did this Humaire kill you?"
"I came from Kazuwari, where the most skillful hunters, the most hardened explorers, the deadliest warriors, all gather to earn the favor of Toamowhai."
"I said I wasn't."
"Ekera, how did they put me on the wrong boat?!"
"Still, you're a Watcher, right?"
"You should speak to Humaire. She can explain it better."
"Speak with Humaire, got it."
"Where is Kazuwari?"
"I promise nothing."
"Get off my boat."
"Kazuwari's a huge island west of Hasongo. It's pretty hard to miss, what with the high cliffs and waterfalls."
"I'm... I don't think I can. You're the only thing I see."
"Maybe we should talk about it later? You seem to have your, uh - hands? - full."
"We can reward you! And there's power and glory to be had. Treasure, too!"
